items.title: France Summons US Envoy Kushner for ‘Unacceptable’ Comments
France summons US ambassador Charles Kushner over antisemitism allegations
items.standfirst: Kushner says in letter to Macron he’s concerned over ‘rise of antisemitism’ and ‘lack of sufficient action’ to confront itFrance summoned the American ambassador Charles Kushner after he wrote a letter to President Emmanuel Macron alleging France had failed to do enough to stem antisemitic violence, a French foreign ministry spokesperson said on Sunday.Kushner, who is Jewish and whose son is married to US President Donald Trump’s daughter, published the open letter in the Wall Street Journal amid deep divides between France and the US and Israel. Continue reading...
items.content: Kushner says in letter to Macron he’s concerned over ‘rise of antisemitism’ and ‘lack of sufficient action’ to confront itFrance summoned the American ambassador Charles Kushner after he wrote a letter to President Emmanuel Macron alleging France had failed to do enough to stem antisemitic violence, a French foreign ministry spokesperson said on Sunday.Kushner, who is Jewish and whose son is married to US President Donald Trump’s daughter, published the open letter in the Wall Street Journal amid deep divides between France and the US and Israel. Continue reading...

ai_summary: France summoned US Ambassador Charles Kushner over his letter to Macron.
Kushner's letter criticized Macron's response to rising antisemitism.
The French Foreign Ministry called Kushner's claims "unacceptable."
The summons is highly unusual diplomatic action by France.
Kushner accused Macron of insufficient action against antisemitism.

clusters.title: Ukraine marks Independence Day as Vance says Russia has made " significant concessions"
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Marks Independence Day Amid Ongoing War

items.title: Ukraine marks Independence Day as Vance says Russia has made " significant concessions"
items.standfirst: Russia accused Ukraine of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight Sunday.
items.content: Russia accused Ukraine of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight Sunday.

items.title: Ukraine marks its Independence Day as war with Russia continues
items.standfirst: A defiant Ukraine marked its independence from the former Soviet Union Sunday amid more fighting with Russia. Chris Livesay reports on how world leaders joined in, voicing their support.
items.content: A defiant Ukraine marked its independence from the former Soviet Union Sunday amid more fighting with Russia. Chris Livesay reports on how world leaders joined in, voicing their support.

items.title: 'Low key atmosphere' as Ukraine celebrates independence day
items.standfirst: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia Sunday, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts. The celebrations in Kyiv were "low key", FRANCE 24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg reported, as "large gatherings of people is still a security risk".
items.content: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia Sunday, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts. The celebrations in Kyiv were "low key", FRANCE 24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg reported, as "large gatherings of people is still a security risk".

items.title: Zelensky vows to continue fighting as Ukraine marks independence day
items.standfirst: Russia said power and energy facilities had been targeted by Ukraine, which accused Russia of "spreading manipulations".
items.content: Russia said power and energy facilities had been targeted by Ukraine, which accused Russia of "spreading manipulations".

items.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of strike on nuclear plant in wave of drone attacks
items.standfirst: Moscow says operating capacity of reactor at Kursk site reduced by 50% as Kyiv celebrates independence dayMoscow has accused Kyiv of launching dozens of drone attacks, including one that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant, as Ukrainians marked 34 years since the country gained independence from the Soviet Union.The drone attack on the Kursk nuclear power plant in western Russia, 37 miles (60km) from the border with Ukraine, caused damage to an auxiliary transformer and forced a 50% reduction in the operating capacity of a reactor, Russian authorities said. Ukraine did not immediately comment on the alleged attack. Continue reading...
items.content: Moscow says operating capacity of reactor at Kursk site reduced by 50% as Kyiv celebrates independence dayMoscow has accused Kyiv of launching dozens of drone attacks, including one that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant, as Ukrainians marked 34 years since the country gained independence from the Soviet Union.The drone attack on the Kursk nuclear power plant in western Russia, 37 miles (60km) from the border with Ukraine, caused damage to an auxiliary transformer and forced a 50% reduction in the operating capacity of a reactor, Russian authorities said. Ukraine did not immediately comment on the alleged attack. Continue reading...

items.title: Canadian PM Carney attends celebrations on 34th Ukrainian Independence day
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Ukrainians should have no doubt about Canada's commitment to their country, as he delivered a speech in Sophia Square during a surprise visit to Kyiv. Carney's first visit to Ukraine came on the invitation of President Volodymyr Zelenskyyto mark Ukraine's 34th Independence Day.
items.content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Ukrainians should have no doubt about Canada's commitment to their country, as he delivered a speech in Sophia Square during a surprise visit to Kyiv. Carney's first visit to Ukraine came on the invitation of President Volodymyr Zelenskyyto mark Ukraine's 34th Independence Day.

items.title: Zelenskyy marks Ukraine Independence Day alongside Canada’s PM in Kyiv
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivered a defiant address against Russia during Ukraine’s Independence Day.
items.content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivered a defiant address against Russia during Ukraine’s Independence Day.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day amid the ongoing war with Russia
items.standfirst: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. France24 welcomes Tetyana Ogarkova, Journalist at Ukraine Crisis Media Center from Kyiv.
items.content: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. France24 welcomes Tetyana Ogarkova, Journalist at Ukraine Crisis Media Center from Kyiv.

items.title: Is Trump’s Ukraine gambit 'sending a signal to the world that America does not stand by its allies'?
items.standfirst: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts.The brutal three-and-a-half-year war of attrition, which has killed tens of thousands of people, has ground to a virtual stalemate, though Russia has managed to eke out recent advances in the eastern Donetsk region. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is pleased to welcome Peter Zalmayev, Director of the Eurasian Democracy Initiative.
items.content: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts.The brutal three-and-a-half-year war of attrition, which has killed tens of thousands of people, has ground to a virtual stalemate, though Russia has managed to eke out recent advances in the eastern Donetsk region. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is pleased to welcome Peter Zalmayev, Director of the Eurasian Democracy Initiative.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day from Soviet Union
items.standfirst: Ukraine is marking its 34th Independence Day this Sunday, commemorating its formal break from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. A day earlier, President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials observed National Flag Day, another key date in the country’s calendar. Ukrainians at home and abroad are preparing celebrations in dozens of countries, featuring concerts, marches, prayers, and charity events. France 24’s Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.
items.content: Ukraine is marking its 34th Independence Day this Sunday, commemorating its formal break from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. A day earlier, President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials observed National Flag Day, another key date in the country’s calendar. Ukrainians at home and abroad are preparing celebrations in dozens of countries, featuring concerts, marches, prayers, and charity events. France 24’s Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day from Soviet Union, after National Flag Day
items.standfirst: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. Charlotte Hughes has the details.
items.content: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. Charlotte Hughes has the details.

ai_summary: Ukraine celebrated its independence from the Soviet Union on Sunday.
Celebrations in Kyiv were low-key due to security concerns.
Ukraine launched drone strikes on Russia during the celebrations.
Russia accused Ukraine of attacking a nuclear power plant.
World leaders voiced support for Ukraine on its Independence Day.

items.title: Evacuations ordered in California's wine country as heatwave fuels wildfire
items.standfirst: The Pickett Fire is growing in California's Napa County, prompting new evacuations as it threatens homes and wineries. The flames, fueled by scorching temperatures and dry conditions, are being battled by hundreds of first responders. Elise Preston reports and Andrew Kozak takes a look at the forecast.
items.content: The Pickett Fire is growing in California's Napa County, prompting new evacuations as it threatens homes and wineries. The flames, fueled by scorching temperatures and dry conditions, are being battled by hundreds of first responders. Elise Preston reports and Andrew Kozak takes a look at the forecast.

items.title: Growing wildfires in Oregon and California threaten homes, prompt evacuations
items.standfirst: Wildfires in California wine country and Central Oregon grew overnight, prompting hundreds of evacuations as firefighters sought to contain the blazes Sunday amid dry, hot weather.
items.content: Wildfires in California wine country and Central Oregon grew overnight, prompting hundreds of evacuations as firefighters sought to contain the blazes Sunday amid dry, hot weather.

items.title: Wildfires in California and Oregon grow, prompting evacuations and warnings
items.standfirst: Firefighters battle blazes amid dry, hot weather as fires in Napa county and Deschutes and Jefferson counties spreadWildfires in California wine country and central Oregon grew overnight, prompting hundreds of evacuations as firefighters worked on Sunday to try to contain the blazes amid dry, hot weather.The Pickett Fire in Napa county had grown to more than 10 sq miles (26 sq km) and was 11% contained as of early Sunday, according to the California Department of Forestry & Fire Protection. Continue reading...

items.title: Millions in West facing dangerous heatwave amid multiple wildfires

items.content: Parts of California, Oregon and Washington state will experience extreme heat at least through Tuesday, forecasters said.(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)

items.title: Evacuations ordered as wildfire blazes California's famed Napa County

items.content: Firefighters are working to contain a blaze currently tearing through California's beloved wine country. The Pickett Fire first sparked Thursday afternoon and continued to rage Saturday.(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)

clusters.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia notified by ICE that he may be deported to Uganda
clusters.neutral_headline: Man Wrongly Deported Faces Possible Deportation to Uganda

items.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia notified by ICE that he may be deported to Uganda
items.standfirst: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man who was wrongfully deported to a high-security prison in El Salvador, was notified by immigration authorities that he may be deported to Uganda, less than 24 hours after his release from federal custody. NBC News’ Gary Grumbach has the latest.
items.content: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man who was wrongfully deported to a high-security prison in El Salvador, was notified by immigration authorities that he may be deported to Uganda, less than 24 hours after his release from federal custody. NBC News’ Gary Grumbach has the latest.

items.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia expects to be detained by ICE again, attorney says
items.standfirst: The lawyer for Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man wrongly deported by the Trump administration to an El Salvadoran prison and then returned months later, says his client is now facing deportation again.
items.content: The lawyer for Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man wrongly deported by the Trump administration to an El Salvadoran prison and then returned months later, says his client is now facing deportation again.(Image credit: Alex Wong)

items.title: Trump administration plans to deport newly freed Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda
items.standfirst: The US government is seeking to deport El Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully expelled from the US in March before returning to face detention in the US, to Uganda, his defence attorneys said Saturday. Abrego Garcia reportedly declined a plea deal that would see him deported to Costa Rica.
items.content: The US government is seeking to deport El Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully expelled from the US in March before returning to face detention in the US, to Uganda, his defence attorneys said Saturday. Abrego Garcia reportedly declined a plea deal that would see him deported to Costa Rica.

items.title: Man wrongly deported from US to El Salvador now threatened with deportation to Uganda
items.standfirst: A man who was wrongly deported to El Salvador by the Trump administration has been threatened with removal again, according to a court filing by his lawyers.
items.content: A man who was wrongly deported to El Salvador by the Trump administration has been threatened with removal again, according to a court filing by his lawyers.

ai_summary: Kilmar Abrego Garcia was wrongly deported to El Salvador.
He is now facing potential deportation to Uganda.
Abrego Garcia's lawyer confirmed the new deportation threat.
The Trump administration is seeking his deportation.
Abrego Garcia was recently released from federal custody.

items.title: 'Incredibly disturbing': Rep. Joaquin Castro reacts to armed National Guard in D.C
items.standfirst: New video showed some National Guard troops deployed to Washington, D.C. carrying firearms Sunday evening. The troops were sent to D.C. this month to support President Donald Trump's push to mitigate crime. Rep. Joaquin Castro joins "The Weekend: Primetime" to discuss.

clusters.title: Keurig Dr Pepper nears $18bn deal to buy European coffee group JDE Peet’s
clusters.neutral_headline: Keurig Dr Pepper Nears $18 Billion Deal

items.title: Keurig Dr Pepper nears $18bn deal to buy European coffee group JDE Peet’s

items.title: Jerry Adler, actor in The Sopranos and The Good Wife, dies aged 96
items.standfirst: Adler was involved behind the scenes of storied Broadway productions before finding acting success in his 60sJerry Adler, who spent decades behind the scenes of storied Broadway productions before pivoting to acting in his 60s, has died aged 96.Adler died on Saturday, according to a brief family announcement confirmed by the Riverside Memorial Chapel in New York. Adler “passed peacefully in his sleep”, Paradigm Talent Agency’s Sarah Shulman said on behalf of his family. No immediate cause was given. Continue reading...
items.content: Adler was involved behind the scenes of storied Broadway productions before finding acting success in his 60sJerry Adler, who spent decades behind the scenes of storied Broadway productions before pivoting to acting in his 60s, has died aged 96.Adler died on Saturday, according to a brief family announcement confirmed by the Riverside Memorial Chapel in New York. Adler “passed peacefully in his sleep”, Paradigm Talent Agency’s Sarah Shulman said on behalf of his family. No immediate cause was given. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Jerry Adler, known for roles in "The Sopranos" and "The Good Wife," has died at age 96.

Adler passed away peacefully in his sleep, according to his family.
No immediate cause of death was given in the family announcement.
He transitioned to acting later in life after decades in Broadway production.
